fields.text:
I’m a Software Developer, whose skill set covers both front-end and back-end technologies. I enjoy working on software solutions helping others and participating in meaningful projects that solve real problems. I’m a strong supporter of open source software development movement, as well as an active member of Portland’s tech community.

This website is a playground for me to experiment with various technologies. Click on the fields below to see the apps that I've created during my learning process.

fields.name: Angry Dice
fields.description: One of my very first coding projects: a simple JavaScript-based interactive dice game for one player with some JQuery animations. The rules are based on the famous board game called Angry Dice.

fields.name: Weather Forecast
fields.description: One of my very first coding projects: a responsive JavaScript app using AJAX and querying the OpenWeatherMap API. The app shows weather data for a given location and changes the background depending on the forecast.

fields.name: Catch a Mole
fields.description: One of my very first coding projects: a one-player game, which uses JavaScript timing functions, score counters and intervals, wrapped in JQuery animations. The goal is to catch as many moles as you can.

fields.name: Caesar Cipher
fields.description: A JavaScript app with responsive design, which encrypts and decrypts words according to the user’s key.  Any positive integer can serve as a key to convert each letter. It was one of my very first coding projects.

fields.name: Find a Pet
fields.description: A Django website for an animal shelter, where the shelter staff can add and edit pet profiles. The app uses django-filters, ModelForms and SQL database queries for creating and searching records.

fields.name: SciFi StudyRoom
fields.description: A JQuery widget, which uses Wikipedia API to load articles on various science fiction genres. Responsive layout was created using Bootstrap CSS.

fields.name: ElasticSearch App
fields.description: A responsive Django web app with a fast, full-text search engine powered by ElasticSearch library. Type the first letter and choose an article from the drop down list. Or just try a keyword to see if there are any hits! The app was deployed with Docker-compose.

fields.name: Urban Amenities
fields.description: This app uses crowd-sourced data to assist people in housing transit. I was a member of a team who created this project at the Hackathon organized by Wome Who Code and sponsored by Nike and Puppet. It took us 6h, and we became one of the winners!
